meanings.definition: Too serious or solemn in manner or attitude.
meanings.sent1: She was overearnest about following all the rules at school.
meanings.sent2: He always seemed overearnest when discussing his favorite books.
meanings.sent3: The overearnest librarian shushed everyone, even the quietest readers.
meanings.sent4: His overearnest apology for accidentally bumping into her made her smile.
meanings.sent5: The overearnest student's constant frowning made his classmates worry about him.

meanings.definition: Excessively earnest or eager in behavior or speech.
meanings.sent1: The overearnest puppy wagged its tail so fast it almost flew off.
meanings.sent2: She was overearnest in her attempts to win the science fair.
meanings.sent3: The overearnest salesman tried to sell ice to an Eskimo.
meanings.sent4: His overearnest enthusiasm for the project was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The overearnest child's constant questions kept her parents on their toes.
